sourceDesc.p: B-J SMOKE SIGNALS By Red Cloud

body.p: A Happy New Year to everyone. So many have inquired of me who it was that “ played” Santa Claus at the Clay school this year and did so well. “Played” get that. Imagine some people can’t believe there is a Santa Claus. Why it was Santa Claus him­ self, of course. They must be like Santa Claus’ children. They don’t believe there is a Santa. They “know” it’s the “old man” who plays it. Reminds one of the stork when he came home from making a call and found Mrs. Stork eyeing proudly a brood of gangling long-legged stork- lings wrapped in swaddling twigs and weeds lying in a chimney flue. “What is all this?” he roared. “Why”, the stork was here while you were away,” the Mrs. S. replied. The Christmas trees of yesteryear shorn of all tinsel trimmings and fra­ gile glittering and glistening oran- ments are thrown away, like empty bottles, no more to brighten the home and gladden the hearts of children. No earthly use whatever it lays dis­ carded awaiting to be carted o ff to the dump. But no! They still can be of ser­ vice to someone as the writer found out. Placed conveniently in two rows, tree alternating, they make the best kind of a snow fence if enough of them can be gotten together. We saw white whiskered 1938 go out leaning heavily on his cane look­ ing like his life started long before he was forty. We saw the new year come in but couldn’t tell whether it was a boy or a girl. I’d hate to be a year because one gets old too quick long before he has any fun. For the people of the old country the new year started with a “ bang”. .
